Title: Early-career Engineer (Rising Talents with 0-3 years experience)
About Job:
About the job
About Us 
Mintegral is a leading programmatic and interactive mobile advertising platform, starting from the APAC region and radiating out globally. Powered by advanced AI technology, we provide global advertisers and developers with innovative, comprehensive experiences. With our efficient mobile marketing and monetization solutions, we help our clients exceed their marketing goals.

As Mobvista‚Äôs self-developed programmatic platform, since Launched in 2015, Mintegral has quickly grown to become one of the largest mobile advertising platform in Asia. We offer a full stack of programmatic products and services including our Self-service Platform, DSP, SSP, Ad Exchange and DMP. We have also created the Mindworks Creative Studio, which offers publishers and brands cutting-edge creative solutions, from traditional creative right through to the latest interactive ad formats. For more information, please visit our website: https://www.mintegral.com/en/

About this role
We don‚Äôt predefine the boundaries of your role ‚Äî you‚Äôll help shape the core direction of our business and tackle frontier problems that don‚Äôt yet have answers.

You‚Äôll move fluidly across research, engineering, and product, driving impact where logic and scalability meet. We firmly believe that ability outweighs tenure.

Your compensation, leveling, and promotions are solely determined by your technical achievements and business impact. Our ultimate goal is to empower you to grow from a top talent into an "intrapreneur" who can drive Mintegral's business growth.

Highlights: Why You'll Love It Here
No Prior Industry Experience Required: We do not require a specific industry background. If you have technical potential, we provide systematic training to take you from 0 to 1.
Impact Core Business from Day One: From your first day, you will contribute to the development of our global advertising systems and infrastructure. Your work will directly translate into visible business growth.
Open & Innovative Culture: We foster a culture that encourages questioning the status quo and innovating. We reject bureaucracy, and every good idea of yours will be taken seriously.
Learn from the Best: Work alongside and learn from some of the most brilliant senior experts in the industry, accelerating your professional growth.

Key Responsibilities
Under the guidance of senior colleagues, participate in the development, testing, and maintenance of specific functional modules.
Collaborate with the team to improve data pipelines, optimize model inference performance, and enhance monitoring systems through data analysis and real-time monitoring.
Proactively identify potential issues and optimization opportunities within the ad delivery system.
Actively participate in technical discussions, proactively learn, and experiment with new technologies to solve practical problems.

Qualifications & Requirements
Experience: 0-3 years of work experience. No prior experience in the advertising industry is also acceptable
Education: Bachelor's degree from top university or a QS Top 100 institution. A background in foundational disciplines such as Architecture, Software Engineering, Mathematics, Physics, Statistics, or Computer Science is preferred.
Core Competencies:
Strong Learning Ability & Self-Drive: Demonstrated by a stellar academic record and/or significant personal/open-source project contributions that prove your ability to learn new concepts rapidly.
Exceptional Logical Thinking: Ability to deconstruct complex problems effectively and reason clearly.
Passion & Proactiveness: Energetic and driven, with the ability to maintain a positive mindset under pressure, proactively solve problems, and strive for positive outcomes.
Resilience & Grit: Willingness to tackle repetitive, complex, and challenging tasks, and the ability to develop efficient personal work methodologies.
Proficient Data Analysis Skills: High sensitivity to data and strong analytical ability. Capable of writing independent data analysis reports. Proficiency in SQL (e.g., MySQL) is a strong plus.

Nice-to-Have
Awards from competitions like ACM/Mathematical Modeling/Kaggle.
A high-quality technical blog or GitHub profile.

Compensation & Benefits
Total Annual Package: Significantly above the industry average.
Post-Probation Review: Your salary will be re-evaluated based on our company standards, taking into account your demonstrated logic, proactiveness, concurrency capabilities, and learning ability.

Title: Software Engineer - Early Career (USA)
About Job:
About the job
Trexquant is a growing systematic fund at the forefront of quantitative finance, with a team of world-class researchers and engineers. As we continue to expand our trading operations, we are investing heavily in building the next generation of our quantitative research & trading platform.
We are seeking an Early Career Software Engineer with strong programming skills to join our engineering team. In this role, you will work closely with experienced engineers and quantitative researchers to develop the infrastructure that powers systematic trading, including data pipelines, back testing tools, and execution systems. You will have the opportunity to contribute to greenfield development projects, where you'll help build new systems from the ground up, driving innovation and scalability in our technology stack.
Responsibilities
Full lifecycle development of low-latency, high-throughput research and trading systems using C++, C, Java, or Rust 
Build and optimize data processing pipelines to ensure reliable access to large, high-quality datasets
Assist in developing tools for back testing, model training, and strategy evaluation
Collaborate with researchers and traders to deliver technical solutions that improve research productivity and trading performance
Participate in code reviews, testing, and documentation to maintain high-quality standards
Stay abreast of emerging technologies, tools, and best practices, bringing innovative ideas to continuously improve our systems


Requirements


BS/MS degree in Computer Science, or a related STEM field
Strong knowledge of data structures, algorithms, and object-oriented programming
Proficiency in one or more programming languages{{:}} C++, C, Python, Java, or Rust
Familiarity with Linux environments 
Excellent problem-solving skills and ability to learn quickly in a collaborative team setting


Benefits


Competitive salary plus bonus based on individual and company performance
Collaborative, casual, and friendly work environment
PPO health, dental, and vision insurance premiums fully covered for you and your dependents
Pre-tax commuter benefits
Weekly company meals

Trexquant is an Equal Opportunity Employer.
